instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3427: What is 820-3427? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3427</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b fan spins no chime no video
threads.message:
Hi All,
This is liquid damaged board. insted of 3 times spinning  at the start it spins about 10 sec then stop and spins again for the second time and no chime.  after 80c ultrasonic cleaning only one time worked well and again back to same situation. connect usb mouse no light but <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> present 1.7v.

not that much liquied damaged only near <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and once replace the <CAPACITOR>C8111</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R8111</RESISTOR> got the fan spins.

Any idea where to check?

Thank you..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3427</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b fan spins no chime no video
threads.message: <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is a common suspect, especially pin 8.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3427</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b fan spins no chime no video
threads.message:
Hi Duke, Thank you for your replay.

<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> seems prety clean and but replaced it and no different. All the pins getting accurate voltage.  <SIGNAL>PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>  3.3v on <RESISTOR>R1962</RESISTOR> . I thought maybe the bios and replced it still the same. any clue?
​​​​​​​

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3427</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b fan spins no chime no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3427</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b fan spins no chime no video
threads.message: Hi John. I know. I just did that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3427</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b fan spins no chime no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3427</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b fan spins no chime no video
threads.message: This is going to suck. Inspect closely around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> where corrosion was. Could be a corroded pad under <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> or a resistor there. Maybe post a good picture if you can.
